<h1>How to fold the Ethiopian Calendar Booklet</h1>
<br>
<table style="text-align: left;" border="0" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="2">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>1</td>
<td><img src="P1040374.jpg"></td>
<td>Print out to an A4 papaer</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td>2</td>
<td><img src="P1040375.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td>Fold
the paper in half on narrow side.<br>
Crease it sharply.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>3</td>
<td><img src="P1040376.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td>Open
the paper, and fold it in half on wide side.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="undefined">4</td>

<td align="undefined"><img src="P1040377.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td align="undefined">Besides
fold it in half on narrow side as the cover page faces outside.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="undefined">5</td>
<td align="undefined"><img src="P1040378.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td align="undefined">Cut
the center of paper.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="undefined">6</td>
<td align="undefined"><img src="P1040379.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td align="undefined">Open
the paper.<br>

There is a hole in the center of paper.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td align="undefined">7</td>
<td><img src="P1040380.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td>Fold
the paper like the first step, besides fold it as it makes a cross.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>8</td>
<td><img src="P1040381.jpg" alt=""></td>
<td>Fold
the paper as the cover page faces outside.<br>
Adjust fold, then&nbsp; it is completed.</td>
